JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Lech Garlicki;Nebojša Vučinić;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their then Agents , PERSON and PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE the applicant and his wife were the subject of articles in the DATE newspaper “ ORG Demokratike ” ( “ the newspaper ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated criminal proceedings against PERSON , the author of the press article which was published on CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the proceedings were discontinued by a decision of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) pursuant to LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a civil action against the newspaper ’s editorial board ( redaksia e gazetës ) represented by its editor - in - chief and sought non - pecuniary damage . On DATE ORG decided that the applicant ’s personality and honour had been seriously tarnished by the press articles . It ordered the payment of CARDINAL NORP leks ( MONEY at the time ) to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG Demokratike sh.p.k . ( “ the company ” ) , a limited liability company registered under NORP law and which is the owner of the newspaper , filed an appeal . The appeal was signed by the newspaper ’s editor - in - chief . The company argued , inter alia , that the editorial board did not constitute a legal entity and could not be a party to the said legal proceedings . Therefore , the court was under a duty to replace the defendant by summoning the company in its place , an act which was never carried out .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ ORG ” ) upheld ORG decision . It held that since the articles had been selected for publication by the editorial board , the latter was liable in its obligations towards third parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE the company appealed to ORG , relying on the same grounds of appeal as before ORG . The appeal was signed by the newspaper ’s editor - in - chief . On DATE ORG declared the appeal inadmissible as it did not include any of the grounds of appeal prescribed by LAW ( “ ORG ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an execution writ in respect of ORG decision of DATE . On DATE the bailiff notified the newspaper ’s editorial board to comply with the judgment within DATE from its notification . The bailiff drew their attention to the mandatory enforcement of the judgment , should they fail to comply with the judgment voluntarily .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following the failure of the editorial board to comply with the judgment , the bailiff ordered the attachment of the funds in the newspaper ’s bank accounts . According to the information received by the banks involved , it was apparent that the newspaper ’s editorial board had no bank accounts , except for CARDINAL at ORG , which had virtually no available funds .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff decided to discontinue the enforcement proceedings ( pushojë ekzekutimin ) on the ground that the newspaper ’s editorial board had no assets .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant contested the order and it would appear that he applied again to the bailiff . On DATE and DATE , respectively , the bailiff ordered the seizure of funds in the newspaper ’s editorial board ’s bank accounts and served the order on the banks concerned in the territory of GPE .

CARDINAL . The banks concerned reconfirmed that the newspaper ’s editorial board did not hold any accounts . On DATE ORG informed the bailiffs that there were no funds in the newspaper ’s editorial board ’s bank account .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent a letter to the Minister of ORG informing him of the continuous non - enforcement of ORG judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that their efforts in DATE and DATE had been unsuccessful owing to the lack of available funds in the newspaper ’s editorial board ’s bank account .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date it would appear that the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG on account of the non - enforcement of a final court judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG by way of an administrative letter informed the applicant that it had examined his request and had decided that the issues raised therein were outside its jurisdiction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Government informed ORG decision of DATE which had declared invalid the writ of execution of DATE . The proceedings in question were brought by the newspaper ’s company , following – it would appear – the attempted enforcement of the decision against the company . The applicant had been summoned to intervene as a third party to those proceedings . In its decision , which was given in absentia , ORG stated that the writ could not be enforced against the newspaper ’s company as it had never been a party to the domestic legal proceedings . ORG further added that , since the newspaper ’s editorial board was neither a legal entity nor a physical person , having regard to the development and application of the law as it stood at the material time in DATE , the writ of execution remained non - enforceable .
CARDINAL . LAW , in so far as relevant , reads as follows :

“ In the protection of his constitutional and legal rights , freedoms and interests , or in defending a criminal charge , everyone has the right to a fair and public hearing , within a reasonable time , by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”

“ The Constitutional Court shall determine : ... ( f ) complaints by individuals alleging a violation of their constitutional rights to a fair hearing , provided all legal remedies for the protection of those rights have been exhausted . ”

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of LAW stipulates the deadline for the submission of applications before that court . Individual applications for alleged violations of constitutional rights must be submitted DATE after the commission of the violation .
CARDINAL . The same time - limit of DATE applies in the event of the notification of a final judicial decision .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court first accepted that the non - enforcement of a final court decision constituted a breach of an appellant ’s right to a fair hearing in judgment no . CARDINAL of DATE . Prior to that , ORG used to dismiss such applications as falling outside its jurisdiction .
CARDINAL . A detailed outline of ORG case - law as regards the non - enforcement of final court decisions has been described in this ORG ’s judgment in GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL/a of the ORG provides that a final court judgment is binding on the parties , their heirs , the court that adopted the judgment and other courts and institutions .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the ORG provides for the possibility of a party to seek leave to appeal out of time .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the ORG stipulates that a judgment can be enforced only on the basis of an execution title , which includes , inter alia , a final court judgment . Under LAW ORG , an execution title is executed at the request of the creditor . An execution writ is issued for this purpose . In the wording of LAW ORG , an execution writ is enforced by the bailiff at , inter alia , the request of the creditor . The bailiff invites the debtor to comply voluntarily with the execution writ in accordance with the time - limits laid down in LAW ORG . Should the debtor fail to comply with a voluntary enforcement within the prescribed time - limits , the bailiff proceeds with a mandatory enforcement in accordance with LAW ORG .

CARDINAL . Under LAW the bailiff is empowered to seize the debtor ’s loans as well as movable and immovable property to the extent necessary for the enforcement of monetary obligations . At the debtor ’s request , seizure may also be imposed on another property if the bailiff considers that it satisfies the creditor ’s needs pursuant to LAW .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ORG , the parties may complain to the court of an act or failure to act by the bailiff within DATE of the said act or omission . There is a right of appeal against the court decision in accordance with LAW ORG . The appeal has no suspensive effect on the execution .

CARDINAL . The bailiff may decide to discontinue execution in accordance with LAW ORG if : a ) the debtor complies with the execution writ ; b ) the creditor renounces , in writing , his right to the enforcement ; c ) the execution writ is repealed ; ç ) the debtor ’s civil action in accordance with LAW ORG has been accepted by a final court decision ; d ) the bailiffs alone or in cooperation with the creditor do not find any assets belonging to the debtor within DATE from the start of the enforcement proceedings . The parties may challenge the bailiff ’s decision to discontinue enforcement at the district court in accordance with LAW ORG .
